intro: Plectritis californica var. rubens, commonly known as the redstem false flax, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
